## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm trying to set up a PBaaS chain and I was wondering, can I use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a currency already supported in Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH?

**AI Assistant:**
Unfortunately, no, you can't use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a currency already supported in Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, in the current testnet release. However, don't worry, this limitation will be removed before mainnet availability. So, you'll have more flexibility in the future.

**User:**
Thanks for the clarification! I'm also updating to the new version of VRSCTEST and I was wondering, do I need to delete any directories after updating?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, that's a good question! If you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this, you need to delete specific directories before running the new update. The directories to delete vary depending on your operating system. On Linux, you'll need to delete `~/.komodo/vrsctest`. On MacOS, it's `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`. And on Windows, you'll need to delete `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`. Make sure to delete those directories before running the new update.
Can I use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a currency already supported in Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH?

No, you cannot use the same name for a PBaaS chain as a currency already supported in Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, in the current testnet release. However, this limitation will be removed before mainnet availability.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
```# Disclaimer
